intro: Raphanus radicula var. rotundus, commonly known as the round-rooted radish, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its short, thick, and often swollen root system, which is the primary edible part. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with small, pinnately lobed leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in cool climates and well-drained soil, often found in temperate regions. This variety is cultivated for its unique, mildly spicy flavor and is used in various culinary and medicinal applications.
